adjective.description: Having a sensation of whirling and a tendency to fall or stagger; dizzy.
examples: Luke felt almost giddy with relief
I felt giddy and had to steady myself

verb.description: Make (someone) feel excited to the point of disorientation.
examples: the giddying speed of the revolving doors

origin: Old English gidig insane, literally possessed by a god, from the base of God. Current senses date from late Middle English.
